Package enumerateWeightedSetCovers

Class SetCoverProblem

  • java.lang.Object
    • enumerateWeightedSetCovers.SetCoverProblem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable
    public class SetCoverProblem
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    The class SetCoverProblem is used to represent an instance of a weighted set cover problem. Internally, a weighted set cover problem is represented by an array of integer weights and an ArrayList of BitSets, each of which is the size of the universe. For a particular set, the members correspond to the bits with value 1

    • Constructor Detail

      • SetCoverProblem

        public SetCoverProblem​(int numOfSets,
                       int universeSize,
                       java.util.ArrayList<java.util.BitSet> setContents)
        Creates an instance of a SetCoverProblem with the given parameters. Used in cloning an object. Note that the weights are not provided as we assume these are already available as a static data member
        Parameters:
        numOfSets - the number of sets in the problem
        universeSize - the size of the universe in the problem
        setContents - the contents of the sets, as an array of sets of lit bits

      • SetCoverProblem

        public SetCoverProblem​(int numOfSets,
                       int universeSize,
                       java.util.ArrayList<java.util.BitSet> setContents,
                       int[] weights)
        Creates an instance of a SetCoverProblem with the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        numOfSets - the number of sets in the problem
        universeSize - the size of the universe in the problem
        setContents - the contents of the sets, as an array of sets of lit bits
        weights - the weights per set

      • makeNonRedundant

        public Solution makeNonRedundant​(Solution prev,
                                 java.util.BitSet covered)
        Parameters:
        prev - a solution to the instance, when ignoring all universe elements indicated by covered
        covered - a set of bits indicating which universe elements can be ignored by the problem
        Returns:
        a nonredundant solution contained in the input parameter. A solution is nonredundant when no set can be removed, while still retaining the set cover property

      • getCoveredBy

        public java.util.BitSet getCoveredBy​(java.util.BitSet sets)
        Parameters:
        sets - a list of sets (indicated by the 1 bits of the BitSet)
        Returns:
        a BitSet of size of the universe which indicates which elements are covered by the sets of the input parameter
